lines: chairperson:  good everyone, everyone.  as you know, this
is the hearing in matter diac 230179.
i'm jennifer kirby and i'm here with bill smith and
andrew mcdougall, we're your arbitral tribunal.
i just ask that if you are not speaking, please be
so kind as to mute your microphones just so that, you
know, we don't get any crossover in terms of
conversation.
mr bin touq, i understand that you're going to be
the principal speaker for claimant today.  just by way
of formality, could you please introduce to us the other
people who are here for claimant today.
mr bin touq:  yes, i'm obaid bin touq, and we have
hatem al amoudi from franklin morgan and we have
sager al sharhan and we have jassim al rafaei and lance
and saad al omeri.
chairperson:  very good.
mr bin touq:  and ali as a witness.
chairperson:  yes.
ms habib, i understand that you'll be the principal
speaker for respondent today.  can you please introduce
yourself and anyone else who's with you today for the
respondent, for the sake of formality.
ms habib:  hi, my name is raheela, i'm a legal counsel for
the respondent, and mr jihad el haddad, senior legal
counsel, is with me to represent the respondents in
these proceedings.
chairperson:  very good.
now, you have all received procedural order 2 which
has the provisional hearing agenda for today.
this is slated to be a relatively short hearing
today.  we have the tribunal's opening remarks,
claimant's opening statement, followed by the
examination of witnesses or, as the case may be, just
one witness today.
we do foresee a break after that and then closing
statements from the parties, followed by discussion with
the tribunal.
now, perhaps we can just turn momentarily to this
issue that arose this morning, mr bin touq, with respect
to mr saad al sharhan and his ability or perhaps
inability to appear today.
could you please tell us a bit more about what's
happening there?
mr bin touq:  yes, saad al sharhan, he have a cancer and
he's under treatment, and yesterday he's been admitted
to the hospital.  he could not attend the hearing today.
chairperson:  i see.  okay.  ms habib, would you like to
address this issue?  do you have any comments on this
issue?
ms habib:  we don't have any comments.
chairperson:  no comments.  okay.
so we will not be hearing from mr saad al sharhan
today, but we do of course still have mr erdogdu here,
so we will be able to have his examination today.
before we do that, are there any other matters of
a preliminary nature before we go to claimant's opening
statement?  mr bin touq, is there anything from
claimant's side of a preliminary nature you would like
to raise?
mr bin touq:  no.
chairperson:  ms habib, is there anything on the
respondent's side of a preliminary nature that you would
like to raise?
ms habib:  yes, i would like to draw tribunal's attention
to the email that i received today.  my name was not
there.  i was not copied.  only mr -- it was
info@jihadelhaddad and case manager, so i was not copied
in that particular email.
so i request the tribunal to check into this matter,
like, respondent always -- should always cc my email
address.  that's my request.
chairperson:  okay.  yes.  mr bin touq, i did notice today
when the email came in that it was not copied to all of
respondent's email addresses.  when i forwarded it,
i made sure that it was, so everybody has now
received it.
but it would be helpful just if --
mr bin touq:  we will make sure going forward, ma'am.
chairperson:  that would be very good.
mr bin touq:  we apologise.
chairperson:  that's fine.  i assumed it was an oversight.
so with that, perhaps we can turn to claimant's
opening statement.  we have foreseen 15 minutes for
claimant's opening statement.
mr bin touq, if you would like to proceed, please go
ahead.
opening submissions by mr bin touq
mr bin touq:  yes.  we are the company having an agreement
to appoint crc to develop their school, and a part of
the discussion and what they have been through, they
came with an agreement with the arbitration clause to
have them developing the school.
they have several discussion till they arrive to
that agreement.  they have the loa and they have the
contract been signed and stamped by them, and now we are
having them not having any proper argument in terms of
why diac have no jurisdiction.
it's been very clearly stand on the contract and loa
which has been signed by them, that as per the diac
rules of 2022 and uae federal law of 2018, diac
arbitration clause been included in the contract.
as you instructed, that to make it very summary
about introduction, i would like to have the witness to
have his own statements and to carry on from there.
we already provide our memo and our standing on the
matter and we see the tribunal have jurisdiction to rule
over that and be very clearly stand in the loa and the
contract.
chairperson:  do you have any further comments you would
like to make by way of opening at this point, mr bin
touq, or should we move to the examination of
mr erdogdu?
mr bin touq:  we are fine with that.
chairperson:  all right.  with that, we can move to
mr erdogdu's examination.
we have allotted 30 minutes for this, even though
i know that, i do recall that respondent asked for
15 minutes, but we added some additional time, just in
case there's any re-direct, mr bin touq, that you may
wish to do or any questions from the tribunal.  we just
wanted to have a little more wiggle room in the
schedule, if need be.
mr ali reso erdogdu
chairperson:  mr erdogdu, we would like to swear you in as
a witness today.  do you have a holy book for that
purpose?
witness:  yes, i do.
chairperson:  what holy book is that, please?
witness:  it's quran.
chairperson:  okay.  would you be so kind as to put your
hand on the holy book, please.
witness:  sure.
chairperson:  if we can see, please.  yes, okay.
if you would be so kind as to repeat after me,
please: i swear by the almighty god.
witness:  by the almighty god.
chairperson:  i'm sorry, sir.  it's: i swear by the
almighty god.
witness:  i swear by the almighty god.
chairperson:  to say all the truth.
witness:  to say all the truth.
chairperson:  the whole truth.
witness:  the whole truth.
chairperson:  and nothing but the truth.
witness:  and nothing but the truth.
chairperson:  thank you, sir.
we have received, in these proceedings, a copy of
your cv, of your curriculum vitae, and we've also
received a statement, a written statement, from you
dated 28 april 2024.
do you confirm the accuracy of your cv?
witness:  yes, ma'am, i do.
chairperson:  and do you confirm the accuracy of the
statement you submitted dated 28 april 2024?
witness:  yes, ma'am, i do.
chairperson:  okay.
mr bin touq, do you want to have any direct with
this witness?  if you do, it could be very brief,
five minutes or so, or are you content that we just pass
directly to cross-examination?
mr bin touq?
mr bin touq:  start examine him, it's fine.
chairperson:  the cross-examination can begin?
mr bin touq:  yes.
chairperson:  okay, very good.
ms habib, we've allotted 15 minutes for your
cross-examination, so if you'd be so kind, you can start
whenever you're ready.
cross-examination by ms habib
ms habib:  so, mr ali?
a.yes.
q.i would like to ask you, my first question is what was
your involvement in the project?
a.okay.  i am a civil engineer and i was the project
manager for the development of arbor school dubai.
q.so what was the duration of your being a project manager
on this project?
a.from february 2016 until the termination and after the
termination.  i was with the company until 2022.
q.so is it right to say that you were involved in the
project from the beginning until the end, until the
termination?
a.correct.
q.and even after termination, you were involved with the
company?
a.correct.
q.so my question is, are you aware about the dubai court
proceedings that happened between the claimant and
respondent regarding this particular project?  are you
aware?
a.yes, i am.
q.you're aware.  okay.  so are you also aware about the
outcome of the proceedings?
a.no, at the moment.
q.so you're not aware about the outcome?
a.i am not aware of the final stage of the court
proceedings.
q.so you're aware about the first stage of the court
proceeding that was the court of first instance?  are
you aware about that judgment?
a.yes, yes.
q.so can you just clarify or can you just tell us what you
know about that particular judgment?  what happened?
a.okay.  as per our contract, the contractor should have
completed the project as requested on technical and
scheduled terms, but failed to do, so there were so many
reasons behind that and the contract was terminated
based on our contract.  and very shortly, we had some
conflict with the contractor, a major one being they
have occupied an operating school during at the very
beginning of the first operational year of the school,
which was reported to the police.
then the court -- the legal proceedings -- many
legal proceedings have progressed.
q.okay.  i will ask you next question.  have you
participated in the proceedings before the experts
appointed by the court?  have you ever attended any
expert proceedings?
a.please define the timing, which court and when?  can you
please specify?
q.yes, court of first instance and court of appeal.
because on both stages, the experts were appointed.  in
court of first instance, one expert was appointed, and
in the court of appeal, the tripartite experts were
appointed, three experts were appointed.
a.we were engaged during --
q.no, i'm asking -- sorry.  i'm particularly asking about
you, whether you were personally involved in those
proceedings or not?
a.you mean attending the court cases?  no.  because all
the court hearings was in arabic and i can't speak
arabic.
q.no, i'm not talking about the court proceeding, but i'm
talking about the experts.  because for experts, even if
you're not arabic person, you can attend before the
experts, because most of the experts are bilingual?
a.yes, they had visited our school in many occasions and
in that sense, yes, i was involved.
q.okay, you were involved.
i would like to draw your attention to your point
number 30, which says that -- in which you mention that
you have never been questioned by dubai experts.  point
number 26.
a.i'm sorry, who?
q.see, in your point number 26 in your witness statement,
you have mentioned that:
"... i have never been questioned by any dubai court
experts, regarding the failures of the respondents."
a.correct, this is dubai court experts, meaning in a court
hearing.  no.  no, i haven't.
q.no, no.  it's not the court hearings.  it's the dubai
courts experts?
a.okay, we have been -- okay, we have been provided many
questions by the court and by the experts.  my
involvement was preparing answers to those questions
with our legal team.  that's what i mean i got involved
with dubai experts.
q.so it means that you have provided them answers of the
questions; right?
a.yes.
q.so it means that you were involved with these experts as
well -- directly or indirectly?
a.i have communicated with those experts, replying their
legal requests, yes.
q.yes.
a.through our lawyers, yes.
q.in your witness statement, when you mentioned:
"... i have never been questioned by any dubai court
experts ..."
it's misleading?
a.i took this question as i've never participated in any
court hearing and confronted any dubai experts in the
court, yes.  my answer is based on that fact, yes.
q.so directly or indirectly, you were involved in those --
with these experts and you have provided your opinion
about what happened during this case?
a.correct.
q.yes?
a.correct.
q.so i would like to draw the attention of the tribunal
members that when, under point number 26, mr ali is
saying:
"... i have never been questioned by any dubai court
experts ..."
can we ask for amendment?  because he has been and
he has confirmed also that directly or indirectly, he
has been involved and he has replied to the questions
raised by the experts.
chairperson:  ms habib, it's not customary in an
arbitration setting to actually seek an amendment of
a witness statement.  it's more that the witness has now
explained his testimony, he's explained his involvement
with the experts, and so we understand his testimony in
that context and we'll take that into account.
ms habib:  okay.  thank you, tribunal.  thank you.
now my next question is -- mr ali?
a.yes.
q.the next question to you is regarding loa, letter of
acceptance.  are you aware that this letter of
acceptance was signed in april 2017?
a.yes.
q.are you also aware that the contract was signed in
a.yes.
q.around three months after?
a.yes.
q.i would like to draw your attention to the contract.
i'm not sure whether you have a copy in front of you or
not.  there is a clause 5.3(b), which says, "priority of
contract documents ..."
in this particular list, i can see that the contract
agreement is at first position, which means the highest
priority in this case should be given to the contract.
and the second number is loa.
the court has decided its case based on the
contract.  so i just want to know one thing.  are you
aware that this loa was never submitted before the
court?
a.i cannot -- i have to refer to my lawyers for the exact
submittal of those documents to the court.
q.can i tell you that the case was filed in 2018 and the
case actually ended in 2024.  in last six years this loa
document, which you are saying that you have witnessed
our client signing this, has never been submitted by
your lawyers to the court.
so how now we can say that this loa has overnight
become so important that whatever happened in six years
should be set aside and we should just follow loa?
a.okay.  my answer to that is i don't have the full exact
submission registers to the court, but i would be very
surprised if that loa has not been submitted to any
court hearing.  so i --
q.this has been --
a.for six years -- just a second.  for six years, i will
be surprised, which is a part of the contract, which is
not submitted to the court.  because i know that, i'm
aware that there are many documents been submitted,
multiple times to the court, to the experts, and i will
be very surprised if loa is not included in those
submittals.
q.yes, but i would like to confirm, it has been confirmed
by the claimant in their submissions before this
tribunal that this loa was never submitted before the
court proceedings?
a.i have to refer to my lawyers for the exact document
register dating.
ms habib:  okay.
mr el haddad:  mr ali, so you said that you had been
participating, or been working in the company since the
beginning of the project --
chairperson:  i'm sorry, mr el haddad, it's not
conventional to switch lawyers in the middle of
a cross-examination.  what is happening here?
mr el haddad:  no, actually, mrs kirby, i thought that we
are both representing the respondent.  i will do
whatever you instruct, at the end of the day, but if you
allow me to ask a question.
chairperson:  well, i think it would be best if the
cross-examination is handled by ms habib, so that we
don't double-team the witness with lawyers here
unexpectedly.
i think mr el haddad, if you have a question that
you would like asked, perhaps ms habib can ask it.
mr el haddad:  sure, no problem.
ms habib:  no problem.  i will ask.  thank you, tribunal.
yes, mr ali?
a.yes.
q.another question is, are you aware that various experts
examined the evidences submitted by us, by respondent,
and issued a report -- (overspeaking) --
a.please define what you mean by "experts".  are they
court experts?
q.yes, the court-appointed experts have submitted two
reports in this matter.  in the court of appeal they
have submitted -- requested by the claimant, the court
has appointed tripartite experts, which means that three
experts were appointed only on the request of the
claimant.  that is your company, al mutatawera.
the court of appeal has accepted that particular
report as final.  so are you aware about this report?
because you were answering those questions.
a.no.  that's a general question.  you have to be specific
which report, because i have to be -- i don't have the
full documents with me.  i can answer this in writing to
the court.  if you specify the exact date and refer to
the exact report, i will be able to give you an accurate
answer.
chairperson:  one moment, one moment.  i just want to
interject here.  just so that we don't drive the court
reporter crazy, please be careful, ms habib and
mr erdogdu, please be careful not to talk over each
other, because it's very difficult for the court
reporter to take down correctly what's being said if two
people are talking at the same time.
i know it's natural in conversation for that to
happen, but here, please, please try to let each other
finish before you begin talking again, so that the
record is clean.
ms habib.
ms habib:  yes.  thank you, tribunal.
mr ali, if you like, i can give you the final expert
report, which was given in the case number court of
appeal number 706/2021 and appeal number 1529.  it was
submitted on 19 march 2023.  if you like, i can give you
the engineers' names as well?
a.i am not aware of that report.
q.are you aware about the eng gassan masood(?) and
eng sukriya saleem(?)?
a.no, i'm not.  if this is 2023, i am not aware of that
report.
q.no, this is not 2023.  this is the final expert report,
which was submitted in 2022.
a.i cannot answer that question.  i have to see the
report.  without seeing, i cannot answer that question.
q.are you aware that your company has given counterclaims
to the experts saying that our client has not completed
the project and there were some outstanding works?  have
you done that?
a.yes.
q.if you have done that, does that mean that you have also
made the counterclaim?  because the expert report
clearly states that you have made several counterclaims,
including 3.27 million, and then another one is
7.27 million, 1.58 million.  so all these experts have
pointed out that these are the counterclaims or claims
that your company has made before the experts, seeking
the expert to give an expert report based on your
counterclaims and deduct our client's claim.  are you
aware about this?
a.as a project manager, i have reviewed the works
completed, i have reviewed the balance of works and
i have quantified those pending, and there were defects.
i have worked in quantifying those incomplete and the
defects and any other monies referred to the contract
agreement.  yes, i have been involved in those
calculations.
but as a whole, as a complete claim, a claim package
is discussed through our lawyers and submitted.
q.yes, i understand.
chairperson:  ms habib, you're technically out of time
already, in terms of your 15 minutes.  do you have --
ms habib:  one more minute only.
chairperson:  okay, yes.  one more question.  go ahead,
and then we'll wrap it up.
ms habib:  mr ali, so you are confirming that you have
quantified your claim before the experts?
a.i am confirming what i just told you.  i am a technical
project manager.  i am aware of the bill of quantities
of the works and the variations and i have been involved
in reviewing, because we had an engineer, we had
a consultant.  i reviewed the consultant's studies,
compared it with our contract and made our objections or
confirmations regarding the incomplete work and the
defective work.
q.so you have -- i would like to summarise that you have
quantified the damages sustained by your company and you
have presented these documents before the experts to
calculate the claims?
chairperson:  ms habib.
ms habib:  that's it.
chairperson:  i was going to say, you're trying to sneak
in another question there.  but we do have closing
statements, so obviously if you would like to give your
own summary or interpretation of the witness's answers,
you're free to do that during your closing statements.
but i think the witness's testimony was very clear and
we have that on the record.
so i think we can stop the cross-examination for
now.
mr bin touq, is there any re-direct examination that
you would like to do in light of respondent's
cross-examination?
mr bin touq:  yes.
now, what we have today, we are discussing about the
jurisdiction.  ali was involved in the starting of the
project, in term of negotiation and in terms of the
progress of the project till its completion.
chairperson:  i'm sorry, mr bin touq --
mr bin touq:  i will ask ali couple of questions.
chairperson:  okay, yes, go ahead, we have budgeted
five minutes.
re-examination by mr bin touq
mr bin touq:  ali, are you involved on the discussion with
the contractor, regarding the loa and the contract?
a.yes.
q.are you aware that diac was a jurisdiction been
confirmed by the contractor and the consultant?
a.yes.
q.accepted by al mutatawera?
a.yes.
q.there was any revision or any changes toward that?
a.no.
q.you confirm that diac was only jurisdiction been
confirmed and accepted by signing the loa and stamp and
also the contract?
a.yes.
q.are you aware that who started the proceeding in dubai
court is al mutatawera or the contractor?
a.the contractor.
q.what was the main argument related to that?  they
proceed in dubai court.  however, they was aware that
the jurisdiction of arbitration was included in the loa
and the contract?
a.yes.  they knew, they were aware that the jurisdiction
was the dubai arbitration, but the proceedings started
through dubai courts.
q.did you attend the signing of the loa and the contract?
a.yes.
q.you involved with the negotiation and the terms been
included that arbitration and diac was only jurisdiction
for this matter?
a.yes, and there were some pre-contract signatures,
communication with the contractors.  so, yes, before the
contract signature, the contract draft was shared with
the contractor.  they had some comments.  we have the
communication and emails over that.  yes, i was
involved.
q.did they involve any time the jurisdiction of the
agreement and any level under discussion?
a.no.
q.did any revision happen toward that clause on the
agreement?
a.no.
mr bin touq:  okay.
chairperson:  mr bin touq, do you have anything further?
mr bin touq:  yes, we are fine.  now, as per him as
a civil engineer, he's not aware on the legal proceeding
and what has been questioned to him by them is not
relevant, because he's only doing his engineering work
related to the matter and he's not aware about the legal
proceeding --
chairperson:  mr bin touq, what i would propose is
similarly to what i said to ms habib.  you do have your
closing statement to make.
mr bin touq:  yes.
chairperson:  so i think the points you're making now are
perhaps better addressed in that context.
mr bin touq:  yes.
chairperson:  for now, while we have the witness,
mr smith, do you have any questions for mr erdogdu?
mr smith:  i don't have anything at the moment.  i think
just to echo your comments, i think we'll just take the
witness's evidence as we heard it and anything else can
be dealt with in submissions.
chairperson:  okay.  very good.
witness:  may i add something?
chairperson:  not right now, mr erdogdu.
mr mcdougall, do you have any questions for the
witness?
mr mcdougall:  i do, if i may.
chairperson:  please.
questions by tribunal
mr mcdougall:  nice to meet you, mr erdogdu.  i'm andrew
mcdougall, i'm one of the members of the tribunal.  can
you hear me okay?
a.yes, sir, nice to meet you too.
mr mcdougall:  i was wondering if you could help us
understand just the way this contract was put into place
from your perspective.
why was there a letter, an loa as it's referred to,
a letter of acceptance, and then a contract document?
could you just explain to us how that came about in that
structure?
a.yes.  the understanding was to commence the early works
and the mobilisation and the permitting for the school
project.  so to earn -- it was basically kicking off the
early work.  so within loa, we manage to apply for nocs
to the government institutions and there was a very
tight schedule, so it's mutually agreed with the
contractor that they can start some early works and some
early registrations.  so based on that, loa came before
the contract, so we had an loa arrangement.
mr mcdougall:  who drafted the loa, if you know?
a.i think we had -- it was by legal team.  we drafted --
i can't fully recall, but it was exchanged a couple of
times for comments.  so by a legal counsellor, it was
drafted.
mr mcdougall:  were you involved in that process or not?
a.yes, i am.
mr mcdougall:  what was your involvement?
a.just a -- yes, just a note.  i particularly remember
installing the dubai arbitration clause into the
contract framework.
mr mcdougall:  who installed that?  you did or somebody
else?
a.i have discussed the ways, the correct ways to install
it with the legal team.
mr mcdougall:  whose legal team?
a.it was our legal team.  we have proposed.  that's how
it's installed in the contract, yes, on the draft.
mr mcdougall:  was there any resistance to that by the
other party?
a.as far as i recall, we have exchanged many emails
regarding the contract draft.  we received some comments
from the contractor.  as far as i recall, there is no
mention or any comments on that clause.
mr mcdougall:  so then after the loa, you had the contract
as you mentioned.  what was your involvement, if any, in
the contract drafting?
a.the contract was prepared by our consultant, national
engineering bureau, reviewed by both parties,
contractors and the investor's legal team.  both parties
have put their comments on and the final contract
document was prepared.
mr mcdougall:  what was your involvement?
a.i was, as the client -- as the investing side,
i reviewed the contract as per my experience on the
technical chapters regarding the schedule, the
deliveries, et cetera, on the contract.
mr mcdougall:  i think that covers what i wanted to ask
you.  thank you very much, madam president.
mr smith:  madam president, can i just ask a follow-up,
just based on what mr mcdougall had asked -- sorry,
mr ali.
just to clarify, i think you said a minute ago in
response to the questions that you had installed
arbitration into the contract.
but my understanding is that that's a standard
provision in the general conditions, that were
incorporated by reference into the agreement.
are you saying that you -- or maybe i'll just ask
you directly.  can you just explain what you meant by
you installed arbitration into the agreement?
a.installed, meaning -- okay, let me explain.  install,
meaning receiving the draft from our consultant, we
proposed to install the dubai arbitration clause into
the contract.  that was a proposal and i was involved
discussions with our legal team, to propose to install
that clause into the contract.  so that's what i mean
"install".
mr smith:  can i just probe that one more time, and this
is just for a matter of clarity.  there's nothing
sinister about it.  but what i'm saying is that in the
general conditions, arbitration is already there.  so it
doesn't need to be installed.  but are you saying that
in the special conditions, you've instructed the changes
to make it the diac, as opposed to the standard form
arbitration agreement?
a.sir, i don't give instructions.  this was
a recommendation, this was our change request to
negotiate with the contractor for dubai international
arbitration court.  i am not fully aware of the
original, what we have received, the exact clause what
we have received from our consultant.  i have to refer
to the original proposed contract document and then what
i'm trying to explain is, after discussion with our
legal team, from the client's side, we propose to
install dubai arbitration clause into the contract.
this was negotiated accordingly and, to my
understanding, signed and agreed by the contractor.
mr smith:  sorry, everyone.  just one question.  this was
a competitive tendered project, wasn't it?
a.correct.
mr smith:  the form of contract that was anticipated, was
that provided to the tenderers from the outset, or was
that later negotiated?
a.part of contract, yes, it was part of the contract, of
the tender package, yes.
mr smith:  i have nothing further.
